In the House, we introduced HR 3, the Lower Drug Costs Now Act of 2019, which will lower the cost of prescription drugs in the US. The legislation will:

Nearly 100 years later, Banting and his colleagues must be rolling in their graves as their life-saving medication is now the poster child for pharmaceutical price gouging. Stories of diabetics rationing insulin - and dying for it - are not uncommon. This is reprehensible.

Banting & his co-inventors refused to have their names on the patent they sold to the Univ of Toronto for a mere $1. They felt it was unethical for a doctor to profit from a discovery that would save lives & they wanted everyone who needed their medication to be able to afford it
Today is #WorldDiabetesDay, designated so as it is also the birthday of Sir Frederick Banting, one of the doctors who discovered insulin in 1921. pic.twitter.com/Yymu7QSWK0
